bestBHT.bht: Early in the morning, a large number of people in Jerusalem rose betimes and came early to hear Jesus speak. This is said in commendation of Christ's hearers and is worthy of imitation. How much happier were his disciples in these early lectures than the slumbers of the morning could have made them on their beds! Let us not scruple to deny ourselves unnecessary sleep, that we may morning after morning place ourselves at his feet, receiving the instructions of his word, and seeking those of his Spirit.

Henry Alford: St. Luke relates nothing of any visits to Bethany.
On the whole question regarding the history of the woman taken in adultery, which some of our MSS. insert here, compare notes, John viii. 1 ff.
This certainly would seem a more appropriate place for it, than that which it now holds.
Marvin Vincent: Came early in the morning [ωρθριζεν] . Only here in New Testament. ===Luke 22:0
Philip Schaff: This suggests that our Lord was for the greater part of the teaching days in the temple.
No miracles are mentioned in this connection; the time for these had already passed.
Up to the last appearance in public before His betrayal, our Lord’s popularity continued.
Archibald T. Robertson: Came early (ωρθριζεν). Imperfect active of ορθριζω from ορθρος, late form for ορθρευω, to rise early. Only here in the N.T.
John Gill: Not all the people in Jerusalem, every inhabitant of the city; this word 'all', is often to be taken with a restriction, and here it designs a large number."
Some out of curiosity, and others from a real love to him, and his ministry, rose betimes, and came early."
This is said, in commendation of Christ's hearers, and is worthy of imitation.
John Wesley: How much happier were his disciples in these early lectures, than the slumbers of the morning could have made them on their beds!
Let us not scruple to deny ourselves the indulgence of unnecessary sleep, that we may morning after morning place ourselves at his feet.
Receiving the instructions of his word, and seeking those of his Spirit.

bhtAttempts.bht: Early in the morning, a large number of people in Jerusalem rose betimes and came early to hear Jesus speak. This commendable act demonstrates their curiosity and love for Jesus and his ministry. It is worth imitating their eagerness to receive the instructions of his word and seek the teachings of his Spirit. By rising early, they found themselves in a more beneficial and blessed state, far better than the slumbers that could have kept them in bed. Let us follow their example, denying ourselves unnecessary sleep in order to place ourselves at Jesus' feet, ready to receive his wisdom and guidance.

Early in the morning, a large number of people in Jerusalem rose betimes and came early to hear Jesus speak. This commendable act demonstrates their curiosity and love for Jesus and his ministry. It is worthy of imitation, for how much happier were his disciples in these early lectures than the slumbers of the morning could have made them on their beds! Let us not scruple to deny ourselves unnecessary sleep, that we may morning after morning place ourselves at his feet, receiving the instructions of his word and seeking those of his Spirit.

Early in the morning, a large number of people in Jerusalem rose betimes and came early to hear Jesus speak. This is said in commendation of Christ's hearers and is worthy of imitation. How much happier were his disciples in these early lectures than the slumbers of the morning could have made them on their beds! Let us not scruple to deny ourselves unnecessary sleep, that we may morning after morning place ourselves at his feet, receiving the instructions of his word, and seeking those of his Spirit.

Early in the morning, a large number of people in Jerusalem rose betimes and came early to hear Jesus speak. This commendable act demonstrates their curiosity and love for Jesus and his ministry. It is worth imitating their eagerness to receive the instructions of his word and seek the teachings of his Spirit. By rising early, they found themselves in a more blessed state than the slumbers that could have kept them in bed. Let us follow their example, denying ourselves unnecessary sleep to place ourselves at Jesus' feet, ready to receive his wisdom.

Early in the morning, a large number of people in Jerusalem rose betimes and came early to hear Jesus speak. This commendable act shows their curiosity and love for Jesus and his ministry. Let us follow their example, denying unnecessary sleep to place ourselves at Jesus' feet, ready to receive his wisdom and guidance. By rising early, we can find ourselves in a more blessed state, far better than the slumbers that could have kept us in bed. Let us seek the teachings of his Spirit and embrace the instructions of his word.
